Adult (Bewick's).description: Tundra Swans are smaller than Mute Swans with a black (not orange) bill. They often hold their neck straighter than Mute Swans.

Adult (Whistling).description: Tundra Swans are smaller than Mute Swans with a black (not orange) bill. Neck and tail shape also differ; Tundra Swans hold their neck straighter and have shorter and more rounded tail feathers than Mute Swans.

Juvenile (Whistling).description: Juvenile Tundra Swans are smaller than Mute Swans with a pinker bill.

Adult.description: Trumpeter Swans have a black (not orange) bill and hold neck straighter than Mute Swans Their tail feathers are also shorter and more rounded than the tail feathers on Mute Swans.

Juvenile.description: Juvenile Trumpeter Swans have a black-and-pink bill while juvenile Mute Swans have a dusky-pinkish bill.

Adult white morph.description: Snow Geese are much smaller with a shorter neck than Mute Swans.
